stories.text:
I am not particularly looking into building one myself, but I have been brainstorming about how one would approach this problem.

Where does one get all jobs data from? I am aware that there are APIs out there from where I can get data from, but that means I am basically building a front-end for data off some other platform(s).

Is getting data from recruiters the only way? How would one get the traction and popularity that they would need in order to attract more recruiters to come post on their jobs board?
stories.title: Ask HN: How does one build a jobs board?

stories.text:
I'm not sure when this happened, but if you are not logged into LinkedIn you cannot view public profiles[1] anymore UNLESS you are coming from a result in a search engine[2].

Which means if you put a link to your LinkedIn profile elsewhere on the web, you cannot guarantee that everyone can view it.

---

[1] https://www.linkedin.com/in/mattowen

[2] https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=matt+owen+mbcs+citp+thirdspace+linkedin
stories.title: Tell HN: LinkedIn requires login to view Profiles (unless you come from search)
